content:
Is there a particular forum or recommended process for commenting and improving Touchstone tests?

I've been going through one of the Touchstone test scripts /FHIR1-6-0-Basic/P-R/Practitioner/Client Assigned Id/Practitioner-client-id-json, and it expects a 200 code(OK) code for a query for a _history; but the spec states that a 404(NotFound) should be sent if the server doesn't support versioning. https://www.hl7.org/fhir/http.html#versioning

I'm fine with implementing versioning over the long run; but it may be 6 or 12 months yet before we get it all in place. In the meantime, I'd like to get the test to have a Warning for a missing 200(OK) code instead of an Error. Shouldn't there be a testing or touchstone channel?
@Abigail Watson I have copied your question over to the new Touchstone stream.
Touchstone (@Mario Hyland ) are you going to serve your TestScript resources by FHIR REST API?
